# Chord: Dominant 7#5 in G (Shape: G)

## Introduction
The Dominant 7#5 chord is a jazzy and colorful chord that adds tension and drama to a musical piece. In the key of G, using the G shape, this chord consists of the notes G, B, D#, and F. The sharpened 5th (D#) creates an edgy and dissonant sound that can add a unique flavor to your chord progressions.

## Notes and Intervals
- G (Root)
- B (Major 3rd)
- D# (Augmented 5th)
- F (Minor 7th)

## Musical Flavor and Genre
The Dominant 7#5 chord is often used in jazz, fusion, and other contemporary music styles where musicians seek to add tension and create a sense of unpredictability. This chord sounds adventurous and can be used to create a sense of movement or to introduce an element of surprise in a musical piece.
